title: How common are sinkholes in the UK? What causes them? - Quora

response.answer_text: The National Karst Database has recorded over 10000 sinkholes on the completed desk study research areas. Source: Sinkholes and karst research - British Geological Survey Now with regards to what causes sinkholes, well, they are formed when the land surface above collapses or sinks into the cavities or when surface material is carried downward into the voids. Drought, along with resulting high groundwater withdrawals can indeed make the conditions favourable for sinkholes to form. Likewise, the most common causes of a sinkhole are really the changes in groundwater levels or a sudden increase in surface water.
